We have JIRA 3.3.2, specifically:

Adding individual JIRA issues is not yet supported, you need to add a query (bug 128933).  However, that bug report is a Mac-specific issue with setting the password value.  I've made it more robust now, but we need to test password setting on a mac.

Rob: could you try it on Brett's Mac, or just get him to try it?  I'm sure it's a quick fix.

Hmm, I've just updated the JIRA dashboard plugin to 0.8.0, and I can't seem to get the "Issue Tracker" view in Eclipse to login to our server.  When I add a JIRA Server, I get a error dialog with: "Bad envelope tag: html". (I'm assuming this is a SOAP service issue).

weird... Any ideas?

I can do some testing if you can send me a replacement plugin jar-set.. ?

ok, I know I'm drifting off topic here, but what is very weird is that I can add the "http://jira.atlassian.com" instance as a JIRA server, as well as "http://issues.apache.org/jira".

Atlassian's JIRA is the very latest, but issues.apache.org one is the same version we're using here at Aconex.  

I'm going to check our JIRA installation has all things SOAP/RPC enabled, just thought I'd put this info in this issue anyway...

ahh.. errr... oooh.. Ignore my last comment, and file that under "User is an idiot".  Our JIRA instance has had the remote services api turned off.. :-$.

ok, so the original issue about StringOutOfBoundsException is still valid, but I'm off and racing with JIRA+Repository queries.. 

Great work guys 'n gals.
I'm sure that others will trip against this too, so I just added a FAQ entry.

FYI: the "Bad envelope tag: html" error looks like a bug in Axis.  It is assuming that if the response code is an error code (in this case a 503) and the content type is not "text/html" then the content must be a soap fault.  The problem is that the content type is "text/html;charset=utf-8" which is confusing it.  This is only a problem with the commons HTTP sender.  I will create an issue on the Axis Jira for this.
I have added a work-around for the StringFieldEditor bug on Mac (need to set password echo char after setting value of editor).
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
